profile_data.summary:
Proficient in developing sophisticated AI-powered software solutions designed for enterprise applications, driving innovation, solving complex business challenges, and catalyzing growth.

1. Linear/Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forest, Naive Bayes, SVM, Boosting Algorithms, Cluster Analysis (K-Means, DBSCAN, Agglomerative Hierarchical), Hidden Markov Models, Bayesian Inference, Maximal Likelihood / MAP inferences, Deep Neural Networks, CNN, RNN, LSTM

2.  Probability Theory, Statistical Inference, Distributions (Gaussian, Bernoulli, Poisson, etc.), Hypothesis Testing, ANOVA Test, Natural Language Processing, Recommender System, Computer Vision, A/B Testing, Causal Inference 

3. Databricks, Spark, MLflow, Kafka, Docker, Scala-SBT, Jenkins, OOP, Streaming Data, Microservices, CI/CD, Jira, Confluence, Git, Cloud Computing (Azure, AWS, GCP)

4. Generative AI, LLM, RAG, Agentic AI System, LlamaIndex, OpenAI, Groq, Hugging Face


Languages: Python, Scala, Java, R, SQL

Homepage: https://dheeraj2444.github.io/
profile_data.headline: Data Science | Machine Learning

experience.description:
I am working as a Senior Data Scientist at Avlino Inc., where I continue to drive impactful initiatives to enhance container terminal operations. I have developed advanced predictive models, including neural networks and tree-based models, to tackle critical business challenges such as container departure likelihood and equipment job completion time. Through the utilization of ECDF analysis and GMM techniques, I successfully identified the optimal distribution and parameters for key events like vessel arrivals and container movements. These efforts resulted in significant improvements in optimization techniques, leading to an impressive 12% increase in throughput. 

To modernize data engineering practices, I established robust data pipelines using Spark Structured Streaming, enabling real-time event ingestion from Kafka topics in Databricks, and efficiently storing processed data as Delta tables in Azure. Introducing Databricks, I orchestrated an end-to-end workflow for ML model development and deployment, leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Kafka, PySpark, MLflow, and DLT pipelines. As the Databricks administrator, I ensured the seamless functioning of the environment and successfully onboarded the entire data science team, promoting adherence to best practices and reducing cloud costs by 15%. 

Furthermore, I showcased my expertise in ETL microservices development using Kafka Streams API in Scala-SBT and proficiently deployed them through Jenkins and Docker. Additionally, within an OptaPlanner software environment, I meticulously defined and implemented numerous rules to optimize the placement of incoming containers in the terminal, effectively maximizing the utilization of limited constraint resources.
experience.title: Senior Data Scientist

experience.description:
During my internship, I have successfully tackled diverse challenges in the field of machine learning. One notable accomplishment was the development of a 3D shape recognition system using voxelization and 3D Convolutional Neural Nets (CNN). I trained the network on the Princeton ModelNet10 dataset, consisting of CAD models, and achieved an impressive accuracy of 87%. 

Additionally, I designed a predictive model to anticipate failures in the Air Pressure System (APS) for Scania Trucks. This initiative aimed to minimize maintenance costs and my proposed solution outperformed the 2nd and 3rd ranked teams in the Industrial Challenge for IDA in 2016. I applied deep neural networks to predict mass reduction for optimized structures, which resulted in significant savings by eliminating the need for manual labor. These experiences honed my expertise in leveraging advanced machine learning techniques to solve complex problems.
experience.title: Machine Learning Summer Intern

experience.description: I built a python based OCR system to identify characters of number plates employing template matching framework. Performed various image processing activities, such as Morphological transformations, Adaptive histogram equalization, contour formation etc. using OpenCV library. The algorithm iterates over different pixel values as a threshold for binarization of gray-scaled images. The segmented binarized characters are then compared with existing templates for identification. It produced an accuracy of 83% in comparison to 76% with the existing one when tested over 1000 images. Currently, I am developing a web application for data management & visualization. I used LAMP stack and integrated google chart API in a bootstrap framework to visualize different graphs.
experience.title: Senior Project Associate

experience.description: I lead several high-impact projects aimed towards growth. I collaborated with the marketing team to develop systems that drove the marketing efforts. In the process, I built a twitter sentiment analysis tool, a logistic regression model to predict the propensity of user retention and developed a system employing k-means clustering for consumer segmentation to mimic consumption patterns in order to optimize marketing ROI. During my tenure, I also devised an algorithm aimed to rank restaurants based on their performance where I implemented scoring algorithm using Gini coefficients and centroid method to allocate weights to different contributing factors.
experience.title: Senior Business Analyst - BI

member.occupation: Senior Software Engineer at Microsoft Azure Distributed Cloud Storage

projects.description: Trained multiple multi-class classification models on 40,000 Flickr images to predict the orientation of  1,000 images. Implemented K-nearest neighbor, AdaBoost (defined multiple decision stumps for weighted predictions), and Neural Networks (implemented backpropagation along with Gradient Descent approach to update weights), resulting in an overall prediction accuracy of 69% for K-nearest Neighbor, and 71% for Adaboost & Neural Networks.
projects.title: Image Orientation Classification

member.occupation: Senior Software Engineer at Microsoft Azure Distributed Cloud Storage

projects.description: Developed a model to perform part-of-speech tagging in English language using Hidden Markov Model, Bayesian inferences, and naive Bayes. Trained the model to calculate initial, transition, emission, and state probabilities on a data consisting of nearly 1 million words and 50,000 sentences. Implemented and compared the performance of Variable Elimination (Forward-Backward Algorithm) and Viterbi Algorithm. Final model resulted in above 50% sentence accuracy and above 90% word accuracy when tested over 2000 sentences.
projects.title: Part-of-Speech Tagging

member.occupation: Senior Software Engineer at Microsoft Azure Distributed Cloud Storage

projects.description: Developed a Naive Bayes classifier to identify the location from where the tweet was written by maximizing the likelihood in order to compare posteriors of all cities. Implemented Multinomial Document Model using bag-of-words and Laplace Smoothening for missing tokens
projects.title: Tweet Classification

projects.description: Developed a N-Queens and N-Rooks solver incorporating Breadth First Search and Depth First Search algorithms
projects.title: N-Queens / N-Rooks Solver

projects.description: Worked on a project aimed at finding the most optimal route between a given pair of cities of the United States. Compared different Graph Search Algorithms, namely, Breadth First Search, Depth First Search, Uniform Cost Search, and A-star on the basis of path cost, time, & space requirements for multiple cost functions
projects.title: Optimal Path Search

projects.description: In this project, I investigated various factors affecting particle settling and proposed a new method to enhance the settling rates of various particles in waste water slurry that emanates from steel plants. The finding were aimed at improving the efficiency these plants by reducing the settling time and thereby facilitating the recovery and recycle of important metals.
projects.title: Enhanced settling of particles in a Baffled Settling Tank

projects.description:
Built a LinkedIn Scraper that takes job title e.g. Business Analyst, Machine Learning, or any
combination of words and the number of pages to crawl as a command line argument from a user and returns the list of all jobs along with job portal, job title, location, company name matching those
keywords. Used BeautifulSoup module in Python
projects.title: LinkenIn Job Scrapper

projects.description:
Built a Movie Recommendation System in Python based on collaborative filtering algorithm that
uses Euclidean Distance or Pearson Coefficient to find similar users and returns the list of top
recommended movies for a given user. Takes method to be used and a number of movies to be
recommended as command line argument. Used MovieLens movies rating dataset from GroupLens.
projects.title: Movie Recommendation System

projects.description:
Built a speaker recognition system to identify time points of speaker change for a given conversation (used YouTube videos) using K-means clustering and MFCC & delta coefficients as features vector.
Used tuneR package in R.
projects.title: Speaker Recognition System
